website_summaries.verdict: A good solution if you only need a small amount of crushed ice, but it's not ideal for producing large quantities.
pros: Portable and doesn't require any power or surface to sit on
cons: You can only crush small amounts of ice at one time, so it's not a good solution if you need a lot at once

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't Even Buy for $5
customer_reviews.text: Is someone kidding me with these 4-5 star reviews??! It will hold 2 ice cubes but then I am not strong enough to crush them so it's one flipping cube at a time. To make matters worse, the two pieces are not permanently hinged so in between crushing one flipping ice cube at a time, you have to hold the bottom to load and then placed the top part on to crush. Awkward... AND the chunks are huge! I too vote baggie and a hammer and will be returning this nearly $20 ridiculousness.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie Blue

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly simple!
customer_reviews.text: After an illness I was on a feeding tube and could only have crushed ice to suck on for weeks, so I tried a lot of methods to fill a glass with crushed ice, and this simple tool was the best, hands down. It is fast, simple, and effective, plus needs nothing but rinsing after use, though it is dishwasher safe. The fancy machines I tried were a huge pain and still didn't work as well, and the 2nd best method of using a hammer and a plastic bag was both louder and produced less consistent sized ice chunks.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: did not crush as well as expected
customer_reviews.text: make and material good but did not crush as well as expected. large chunck left and have to be altered and moved to crush . I expected smaller chips and all smaller than this item does
customer_reviews.author: JACKSON DAVIDSON

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product except for one thing
customer_reviews.text: I use this crusher multiple times per day! It’s easy to crush and the size if ice after use is perfect. I bought this bc I remembered my mom using one to crush us ice when my brother and I were little. This was the only manual one i could find. The lack of a 5 star rating is because tiny paint chips are in every glass of water. Im pretty sure they are safe and they are tiny, so I don’t mind but Id rather not drink paint chips. Otherwise great product
customer_reviews.author: Kristie

customer_reviews.title: Annoying about the design
customer_reviews.text: It works for occasional use. Annoying about the design: the two sides hook together so you could rinse them sepaerately, which means the hinge is not permanent and easily comes apart while using it to crush. I use it with ice pellets from fridge which get stuck in the ridges quit easily. I usually end up filling a ziplock with chunks created with this and then use a mallet to smash them into finer pieces. It's an awkward tool to use for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Very small and simple to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this ice cube crusher a number of times. If the ice cube is placed in it properly, and held with the bottom part down, it crushes the ice perfectly. The thickest edge of the ice cube should be placed along the forward part of the crusher (near the hinge line). Its perfect for making single drinks. Remove the top part and dump the crushed ice into the glass. Do this two or three times or more depending on how much ice is desired.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Sepstrup

customer_reviews.title: I was so happy to see it again
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these that I had bought 30 years ago and somehow lost it. I was so happy to see it again. So much easier when I want ice that is crushed in larger chunks. It's easy to use and I don't have a lot of hand strength. It crushes one cube at a time and I don't have to connect anything. I use the crusher in my freezer when I want it crushed more finely.
customer_reviews.author: Norma jean Phillipp

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use for yourself
customer_reviews.text: Maybe you can use it with one more guest, otherwise everyone has to crush their own ice. It sometimes can take a bit of time/effort if you want a whiskey glass filled with crushed ice. I love it and use it all the time. The quality is impeccable. For every whiskey drinking that likes it with just a bit of crushed ice, this thing is awesome! Also for cocktails I imagine.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty handy
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great......as long as you are only making a few drinks. After that it would take a while to get the amount of crushed ice you desire. Fits two cubes at a time.
customer_reviews.author: MDS

customer_reviews.title: Halves fall apart, ice chunks are too big
customer_reviews.text: The two halves fall apart very easily and it doesn't crush ice finely enough. Crushed ice should be in chunks small enough to bite through. This crusher just makes smaller ice cubes out of large ice cubes.
customer_reviews.author: Eldergoth

customer_reviews.title: Crush ice easily by hand
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. No complaints whatsoever. Put an ice cube in there. Squeeze it. Voila! Crushed ice. Rinse it off and put it up for use the next time. Couldn't be simpler or more effective.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly

customer_reviews.title: hard o push down
customer_reviews.text: This didn't really break the ice cubes into smaller chips or pieces - very hard to push down on the cubes - would not order again and probably wont use hardly at all - waste of my money
customer_reviews.author: Faz

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t crush a lot of ice at once, but does a nice job with what it does crush
customer_reviews.text: Crushing a single cube of ice at a time seems more tedious than it is. I get through a couple average-sized ice cube trays in maybe 5 minutes. Not so bad. And the device itself dries easily and takes up very little storage space.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cruze

customer_reviews.title: It does crush ice.
customer_reviews.text: Very awkward to use because of ridiculous hinge. I doubt very seriously that the designer of this device ever used it himself. Handles are much stronger than they appear and it will crush an ice cube.
customer_reviews.author: William L. Rayfield

customer_reviews.title: It does s good job
customer_reviews.text: It was small, served the purpose that I wanted, and I would recommend it to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny A

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the ice crusher.
customer_reviews.text: The way the pic looks, I thought there were two hinges, but it only has one. Initially, that disappointed me, but when I used it, it is exactly what I want, and the smaller 1 hinged version fits in my kitchen drawers better. Really happy with it, the condition it came in and the packaging. So much so that I recommended this to co-workers looking for a manual ice crusher.
customer_reviews.author: rg051356

customer_reviews.title: Grey paint/coating flakes off
customer_reviews.text: Works really well for what’s it’s designed to do, but the grey paint or coating soon starts flaking off and contaminates the ice, found out when I started picking pieces of it out of my teeth.... It it was stainless steel there would be no need for a coating or paint. Can’t believe this is the only version of this tool available
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The right ice crusher
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for this type of ice crusher for 7 years! Finally found it, this is it! Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: steve c.

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Solid manual ice crusher. Will not give you small cubes (look at the design of the teeth) but provides for easily crushed ice for drinks, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crushingly Good
customer_reviews.text: Many years ago I recall that my father had an ice crusher like this. From time to time over the years, I have had need for such a device but had never found one in stores. Recently, I looked on Amazon and found the Westmark ice crusher. It came quickly and was well packaged. I withheld a star only because I was hoping it would produce more finely crushed pieces for a project I have in mind. For general purposes, it does well.
customer_reviews.author: Mallard

customer_reviews.title: What do you mean there's no plug?
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's old school. So is my kitchen. I don't need to use one of my 3 working outlets to plug this in. It works my human power. Does a good job and I'm happy with it. (And our nearby kitchen supply store charges more for it.)
customer_reviews.author: Jim H.

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed when it arrived -- it looked so flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed when it arrived -- it looked so flimsy, the handles looked too short. But it works really well & with less hassle & mess than using my rolling pin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon user

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and reliable, small in size so it fits any drawer
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful device, not for large quantities, though. Is very easy to use and makes the cocktails a lot better, with the crushed ice, without having to hammer down on a bag of ice to get your cocktails to look and feel better. Neighbor-friendly!
customer_reviews.author: felipe

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. The upper and lower parts detach allowing flexibility to crash the cubes. Very powerful! Made in Germany. Handy, cool tool to have around!
customer_reviews.author: anakonda

customer_reviews.title: Strong ice crusher to make perfect on the rocks drinks
customer_reviews.text: It's the best ice crusher I've seen for adult drinks. If you like your advice 'straight on the rocks', this is great.
customer_reviews.author: NE Major Dude

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: The ice crusher works perfectly. It is convenient since there is no limit on the number of ice cubes that can be crushed for one drink or half a dozen.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Black

customer_reviews.title: Same quality as 50 years ago.
customer_reviews.text: It's all I expected as we had one when I grew up. However, now that I am retired, my strength isn't what it once was which makes it harder to press the cube. That's on me so will work on arm strength! : ))
customer_reviews.author: Becky Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Simple but Strong
customer_reviews.text: Crushes ice nicely. It has a strong hinge and the grips allow for a powerful squeeze. It's simple technology, but works well.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio man

customer_reviews.title: Works well on one cube at a time
customer_reviews.text: The gadget is too small and can only crush one ice cube at a time. Works well if you are patient enough. We were not and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Batchelder

customer_reviews.title: Use a baggie and a hammer!
customer_reviews.text: Very awkward to use. The two pieces always come apart. I wish I had returned this earlier.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Greenlow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The manual ice crusher works great even with bigger cubes (they just need a little extra squeezing)
customer_reviews.author: suzieleigh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Hand Made Cocktails
customer_reviews.text: Simple, efficient, effective. Note the two parts come apart. At first I didn't like this but now it makes it so easy to clean and dry. If you're looking for crushed ice for cocktails (i.e. NOT shaved or finely crushed), this is perfect. Great idea.
customer_reviews.author: nacnud

customer_reviews.title: Good crusher
customer_reviews.text: Love this little gadget. Does only one cube but crushes it very quickly if you need it for a mixed drink of some kind.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemarie L. Kury

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: An expensive, awkward gadget that can only crunch one ice cube at a time. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: carl b

customer_reviews.title: I thought it would have been a little bigger for ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would have been a little bigger for more ice to be crushed. For what it can hold it does it's job crushing ice.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Stay cool with crushed ice
customer_reviews.text: Crush ice cubes. Have not yet teues but confident it will be fine on the rocks
customer_reviews.author: alfred bogdanoff

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Only does one cube at a time, but does it well.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE D

customer_reviews.title: Crushes cubes badly.
customer_reviews.text: Accepts only very limited sizes of ice cubes, and then crushes them unsuccessfully. Most refrigerators don’t make square cubes any longer. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Thorne Sparkman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't crush ice
customer_reviews.text: If you want crushed ice don't buy this. All it does is break up a cube into smaller pieces; not crushed.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Mac

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes crushed ice and our refrigerator only makes cubes. This solves the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: my husband loves it and the price was right !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: If you want to crack a small of amount of ice this is for you. I' don't have alot of strengh in my hands and this is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: orange kitty

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for what I bought it for. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: CFP

customer_reviews.title: ice crusher
customer_reviews.text: Works great but a little awkward because the 2 halves want to apart when you open it up. But still great product!
customer_reviews.author: garyln

customer_reviews.title: Very small
customer_reviews.text: Way too small to be practical You can do one cube or two at max
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Al Hammadi

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Easy to use. Will crush 2 cubes at a time from our ice maker.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetsue

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife for her birthday and she LOVES IT! Easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Sid

customer_reviews.title: Hand held ice crusher
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for one of those for years. Glad I found it.
customer_reviews.author: SUSAN   N.

customer_reviews.title: I use this with the crescent ice cubes, 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this with the crescent ice cubes, 2 at a time, that come from my automatic ice maker (as found in many recent refrigerators). Requires normal grip strength, a simple no frills solution that works. Would have given it 4 or 5 stars if the price hadn't almost doubled since I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: JimG

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The ice crusher is well made and does the job. The item arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Lady

customer_reviews.title: This doesn't do much of a job... ...
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't do much of a job... typically crushed ice should be about the same size, this is large chunks with some medium and no smaller chunks. Weird.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Fun to Use!
customer_reviews.text: O.K., it's a little odd looking, and you only can crush 2 crescent cubes at a time, but it is so much fun to use! Put the cubes in, press the handles together, it goes CRUNCH, and you have crushed ice. You get an irregular crush, but none of the pieces are too large. It does work better if it's slightly wet. It really doesn't take that much hand strength to use - I'm a small woman and it works fine for me. The only downside is that the two pieces of the crusher just hook together at the top and come apart really easily if you're not paying attention.
customer_reviews.author: MsMargo

customer_reviews.title: My mother had this when I was a kid (I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: My mother had this when I was a kid (I'm 62) so this is a very vintage item. It does not really crush, it breaks the ice into around 6 pieces. I never bothered fixing my ice maker and crusher in our fridge so this is an adequate substitute. It is limited, messy (ice chips spray all over) very hard to get the ice to break and pieces are too big. I won't say don't buy it but know its limitations.
customer_reviews.author: Stew from Queens

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't recommend this crusher based on the quality of the metal
customer_reviews.text: The item does work as described, it crushes ice. However, when the description reads the crusher will crush small portions of ice, it should actually read one cube at a time. Nor would I call crushing one cube at a time a fast way to "rapidly cool" my summer drink...considerably disappointing. Is the crusher simple to clean? Yes, but how much cleaning do you have to do when crushing frozen water?? The weight of the item feels cheap, I was expecting it to be significantly more weighted. I couldn't recommend this crusher based on the quality of the metal, size and the cost.
customer_reviews.author: ljgm6

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I would not want to have to crush a large quantity of cubes, but for my purpose this works great! I didn’t want a big electric crusher or ice shaver, just something that could crush a few cubes when I need them. Works great, easy for my 61 year old woman hands to use and stores easily in my utensil drawer. I saw it demonstrated by The Crazy Russian Hacker (that’s what he calls himself, you can see him on YouTube) and knew I had to give it a try. A definite buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This crusher fits the reason I bought it. To crush ice without using a machine that rusts and break. The only issue with this product is that it is though on the hands. It is hard to squeeze to crush the ice. You have to use small pieces of ice. The ice also can pop out. I realized this was all predictable and I expected this. I just didn't realize it was so hard to crush the ice. I use a rubber hammer crush the ice using the impact method.
customer_reviews.author: GI consumer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent service and prompt shipment. The item is well made and performs as stated. To fill one Old Fashioned glass with crushed ice you would probably need to use about 6-8 ice cubes, one or two at a time depending on size. The ice once crushed is about 1/8-1/4" in size. I am satisfied with it for my uses. If making ice for a crowd this would be a bit slow but for two is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: too small and bad hinge design
customer_reviews.text: Its too small, it barely holds 3 small moon shaped ice pieces from my refrigerator ice maker. Have to refill 4 times just for filling a small cocktail glass. Also the hinge has a wide open slit, keeps breaking apart every time you are making a refill. Too costly for such a bad designed and small piece of metal
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: It works, but if you don't hold this ice crusher just right, it will bite the daylights out of your hand. There is really no way of crushing ice slowly, so if you pinch your hand its gonna be quick and hard. I also think it could be improved if both pieces were connected with a permanent hinge or pin, but they separate freely. I have to reassemble it after every cube.
customer_reviews.author: B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Stress Reliever and ice crusher.
customer_reviews.text: This has made my life simpler and has allow me to vent some anger out on some poor ice. Crushing ice is so easy now that I don't have to get a sledge hammer to do the job (just kidding). You just need to put the ice into the opening and squeeze HARD if you have anger. If you don't have anger, that's okay because this doesn't take a ton of effort to squeeze. I was scared it might be a little flimsy possibly where the two pieces meet but I was wrong. This kitchen tool is very sturdy and looks like it can handle drops.
customer_reviews.author: Mei Lee

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift, but used it a few times to test it. Does the job and seems durable, only ( minor) complaint is the "hinge" part is not connected, but more a hook in a loop, which makes it come apart VERY easily. I suppose that makes it easier to clean and dry though.
customer_reviews.author: pamela

customer_reviews.title: Great little ice crusher
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how expensive electric ice crushers are these days. I don't NEED crushed ice but thought it would be nice for summer cocktails. This is perfect! It doesn't shave or crush the ice, it breaks into pieces slightly larger than a garden pea which is fine with me. Stores easily in a draw and cost of fraction of what the powered ones did. Happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: O. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This did not require much strength to break ice cubes. Small chunks rather than crushed. I'm 62 and had no problem with it at all. Best of all quiet. Well made and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great manual ice crusher
customer_reviews.text: We had one of these when I was growing up. It was always so fun to make our own crushed ice. This was way before built in ice makers that would do it for you. Seems to be almost identical the the one we had back then.
customer_reviews.author: NanaL

customer_reviews.title: Love crushed ice.
customer_reviews.text: This was the only handheld ice crusher to choose from, but I really like it. It crushes two ice cubes at a time which may seem tedious, but it's not. I can Crush ice in the morning for my iced coffee in a matter of a minute or so.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Sylvester

customer_reviews.title: Worked just fine
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I was looking for. Local kitchen and bar tools stores did not have it so Jeff came through again. This is of excellent quality and allows you to control the amount of crushing.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I expected more from this German engineered product. It does break ice cubes, one cube at a time. However, the size of the "crushed" pieces are pretty large, larger than one would want in a cocktail calling for "crushed" ice, which is what I purchased the item for. Also the handle is awkward and falls off constantly. I'm going to return this item.
customer_reviews.author: Angie R.

customer_reviews.title: It's a good simple manual crusher. You can fit about 2 medium sized ice cubes in it.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good simple manual crusher. You can fit about 2 medium sized ice cubes in it. It can take a fair amount of hand strength to crush the cubes but it does a good job of mashing them into little chunks.
customer_reviews.author: S. White

customer_reviews.title: Not practical - can't fit a normal ice cube
customer_reviews.text: This is not a very good ice crusher. It barely works and does not work with big ice cubes. The crusher looks extremely well made, but it is too small to be practical and if it was bigger it needs something to provide leverage in order to break the ice. I would not recommend this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: It is perfect for crushing cubes for 1-2 drinks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use in RV. It is perfect for crushing cubes for 1-2 drinks. It's very sturdy, packable, comes apart for cleaning and no electricity required!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine S.

customer_reviews.title: Fair to okay..  better options out there.
customer_reviews.text: Its okay at best. Cumbersome. Ice goes everywhere. Good build quality, but the hand crank type are superior. Best of the best, electric ice crusher. Save up your money..
customer_reviews.author: Program4Food

customer_reviews.title: This is just perfect
customer_reviews.text: Don’t have room for a big ice crusher, this does the job! It would be time consuming if you wanted to do a lot, but for a shaker full it’s great
customer_reviews.author: Dee Miler

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It works put hard to push. Wish it was a bit more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Sudsy476

customer_reviews.title: Works very well to create the crushed ice for cocktails
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a manual ice crusher for ages. This one is perfect
customer_reviews.author: BBH

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm, crush one ice cube very quicky. Perfect for one or three cocktails. Wonder what other uses I’ll find for this, crushing nuts?
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Going Old School:  Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these 30+ years ago. Unfortunately, it got lost in a move and I'd been looking for a replacement for years. My husband found it on Amazon and we ordered two -- one for us and one to give away. It's a great little device for cracking ice cubes into small pieces; perfect when you only need one to a few. It's really convenient since it's done manually. A real plus is that there's no big, clunky, noisy machine needed.
customer_reviews.author: Cynbad

customer_reviews.title: The description says "This easy to use product will quickly crush small portions of ...
customer_reviews.text: The description says "This easy to use product will quickly crush small portions of Ice with little to no effort." The small portion is one ice cube. It would take a lot of crushes to even fill a small glass.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Dorsz

customer_reviews.title: Eaactly as described - a Manual Ice Crusher
customer_reviews.text: Product was exactly as described, delivered on time and works as advertised. Wanted a manual ice crusher and this works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: JoJo  SRQ

customer_reviews.title: I got it for my husband. He likes it ...
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my husband. He likes it. He can crush a few cubes when he wants them, as many or as few as he needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very fun to use and very effective
customer_reviews.text: Crushed ice ain't a problem in my house anymore. I just pop two ice cubes in there and squeeze away. Very fun to use and very effective.
customer_reviews.author: Hana

customer_reviews.title: Crushes ice without pulverizing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to crush ice for mint julips. Easy to use, makes great chunky ice.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Kalkwarf

customer_reviews.title: Crushes the competition
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, nice crush, fits one standard ice cube at a time. Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Nursing Uncensored

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works ok but only holds 1-2 cubes at a time
customer_reviews.author: Mikki

customer_reviews.title: cool! Heavy duty industrial
customer_reviews.text: cool! Heavy duty industrial, a great bargain, it only does one cube at a time.Solid vendor, all as ;promised
customer_reviews.author: LyndonL

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and easy to use, but it doesn't crush the ice as finely as I would like and bits of ice tend to fly everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This tool while well made was not as easy to use as reviews suggested it required a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: This tool while well made was not as easy to use as reviews suggested it required a lot of hand strength to get uneven results. My strong husband decided to go back to using a hammer. I eventually got him an ice tapper which he greatly prefers
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L

product_meta.title: Westmark Germany Manual Ice Crusher (Grey)
product_meta.description:
Features:
- High quality cast aluminum base
- Ergonomic handles
- Dishwasher safe

About the Brand:
HIGHEST QUALITY WITH TREND AND TRADITION! Westmark of Germany is well known for its quality craftsmanship of kitchen gadgets. Westmark has been making reliable kitchen products for over 50 years. As a specialized and reliable partner, Westmark offers a wide range of practical and uncomplicated kitchen products designed to make cooking and life in the kitchen easier. For traditional reasons, Westmark produces most of their products in Elspe, Germany. 

Money Back Guarantee: If you are not happy with our product, simply return the item to Amazon for a full refund, but we are confident that you will LOVE our product!
feature_bullets: MATERIAL: Each product is made using high quality heavy cast aluminum for its base and handle. See below for more details.

EASY AND READY TO USE: This easy to use product will quickly crush small portions of Ice with little to no effort. Ideal for cocktails, mixed drinks, and to rapidly cool your summer drinks. Equipped with an ergonomic handle, Westmark’s product is efficient and comfortable to use.
5 YEAR WARRANTY: Backed with a 5 year warranty, Westmark is completely confident that you will love their product or we will refund your money back, no questions asked!
MADE IN GERMANY HIGH QUALITY KITCHENWARE: Westmark’s Ice Crusher is among the best in the world and is rated to be one of the best kitchenware brands available today.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars257 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
